name: Test number of jobs from the c4media website against Peviitor API Response

statusDetails.message: AssertionError: Company website contains more jobs than on peviitor
statusDetails.trace:
get_job_details = ((['Drupal Developer (full-time, remote, South-America, Europe, Africa)', 'Senior Editorial Software Community Manager...r-in-chief)/26', 'https://c4media.com/open-positions/editorial-production-assistant-(full-time,-remote,-romania)/27']))

    @pytest.mark.regression
    @pytest.mark.API
    def test_c4media_job_count_api(get_job_details):
        allure.dynamic.title(f"Test number of jobs from the {company_name} website against Peviitor API Response")
    
        scraped_jobs_data, peviitor_jobs_data = get_job_details
        with allure.step("Step 1: Get job links from the scraper"):
            job_links_scraper = len(scraped_jobs_data[3])
        with allure.step("Step 2: Get job links from the Peviitor API"):
            job_links_peviitor = len(peviitor_jobs_data[3])
    
        with allure.step("Step 3: Compare number of job links from scraper response against Peviitor API Response"):
            allure.attach(f"Expected Results: {job_links_scraper}", name="Expected Results")
            allure.attach(f"Actual Results: {job_links_peviitor}", name="Actual Results")
>           TestUtils().check_job_count(job_links_scraper, job_links_peviitor)

expected_links_count = 3, actual_links_count = 2

    def check_job_count(self, expected_links_count, actual_links_count):
    
        if expected_links_count < actual_links_count:
            msg = f"Peviitor is having extra jobs not available on company website"
        else:
            msg = f"Company website contains more jobs than on peviitor"
    
        if not expected_links_count and not actual_links_count:
            msg = f"Scraper is not grabbing any job links"
            allure.step(msg)
            raise AssertionError(msg)
    
        allure.step(msg)
